description: Number of orbits of length n in map whose periodic points come from A059990.
references: V. Chothi, G. Everest, T. Ward. S-integer dynamical systems: periodic points. J. Reine Angew. Math., 489 (1997), 99-132.
T. Ward. Almost all S-integer dynamical systems have many periodic points. Erg. Th. Dynam. Sys. 18 (1998), 471-486.
links: A. Pakapongpun, T. Ward, Functorial Orbit counting, JIS 12 (2009) 09.2.4, example 27.
Y. Puri and T. Ward, Arithmetic and growth of periodic orbits, J. Integer Seqs., Vol. 4 (2001), #01.2.1.
formula: If b(n) is the n-th term of A059990, then a(n)=(1/n)* Sum_{ d divides n } mu(d)b(n/d)
author: Thomas Ward (t.ward(AT)uea.ac.uk)
